quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Ted Kennedy and Sarah Palin
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these terms has Sarah Palin used to describe herself?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fiscal conservative

questions.question: In 1956 Ted Kennedy was a starting end on what Ivy League football team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard

questions.question: Ted Kennedy served how many terms in the senate and for what party?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9 - Democratic

questions.question: In 2006, Sarah Palin became Alaskas 2nd female Governor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1969 Ted Kennedy plead guilty to what charge?

options.text: Leaving the scene of an accident

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leaving the scene of an accident

questions.question: Ted Kennedy was the youngest of how many children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: Who did Sarah Palin beat out to get on the ticket with Senator John McCain?

options.text: Tim Pawlenty, Mitt Romney, Joe Lieberman and Geraldine Ferraro
Tim Pawlenty, Mitt Romney, Joe Lieberman and Tom Ridge
Rudy Giuliani, Mitt Romney, Roger Moore and Tom Ridge
Rudy Giuliani, Mitt Romney, Joe Lieberman and Tom Ridge

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tim Pawlenty, Mitt Romney, Joe Lieberman and Tom Ridge

questions.question: What sport did Sarah Palin play in high school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: basketball

questions.question: Senator Ted Kennedy was married 4 times.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was the cause of Ted Kennedys death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cancer

questions.question: What is the name of Sarah Palins husband whom she married in 1988?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Todd

questions.question: In what year did Ted Kennedy run for President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: Joseph Kennedy Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy clan, was not in the political arena.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following periods was part of the Age of Exploration?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15th - 17th Century

questions.question: Ted Kennedy was a Bill Clinton supporter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: England and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mary, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the commander of the first ships to sail directly from Europe to India during the Age of Discovery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vasco da Gama

questions.question: She was Queen consort of England from 1486 until 1503 and mother of King Henry VIII of England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth of York

questions.question: Who is traditionally regarded as the discoverer of the New World?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Columbus

questions.question: The first Northern European mission exploring North America was led by Italian explorer Giovanni Caboto (John Cabot).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The travels of what famous sailor are described in a 13th century travel book known as The Million?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marco Polo

questions.question: Known as the Virgin Queen, she was the last monarch of the Tudor dynasty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth I

questions.question: Madeira, discovered by Portuguese sailors between 1418 and 1420, is an archipelago located in this ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlantic Ocean

questions.question: What English noblewoman was known as The Nine Days Queen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Jane Grey

questions.question: In what country were the first ocean-going vessels developed during the 15th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portugal

questions.question: Name the queen whose reign of 63 years and 7 months was marked by a great expansion of the British Empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victoria

questions.question: What were the most popular and desired trading goods during the Age of Discovery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: gold, silver and spices

questions.question: Mary I, usually remembered as Bloody Mary, was Queen of England and Ireland and Queen consort of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spain

questions.question: Queen Anne, who ascended the thrones of England, Scotland and Ireland in 1702, belonged to this dynasty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stuarts

questions.question: The rise of what country limited the possibilities of European overland trade during the 14th and 15th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ottoman Empire

questions.question: The term Old World was used to refer to Europe, Asia and Africa.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Number and Following
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, following. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these scientists does not have an internationally accepted SI (système internationale) physical unit named after him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Clerk Maxwell

questions.question: What is Greshams Law?

options.text: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.
It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take this law into account.
Bad money drives good money out of circulation.
Everything is related to everything else, but near things are more related than distant things.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad money drives good money out of circulation.

questions.question: Emedeo Avogadro has both a physical law and a physical constant (a number) named after him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which term is derived from the name of a 19th century land agent in Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boycott

questions.question: Banting is what William Banting became well-known for doing. What is it?

options.text: Plagiarising by translating and adapting foreign language publications
Suing people for pleasure or spite, with little regard for the costs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dieting to lose weight

questions.question: What British monarch fell in love with her future husband, Prince Philip of Greece and Denmark, at the age of 13?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth II

questions.question: What are the islets of Langerhans, named for Paul Langerhans?

options.text: Parts of the human retina where (intensity-sensitive) rod cells cluster among the (colour-sensitive) cone cells
A region of partly submerged reefs off the southern coast of Java
A cluster of relatively stable dark spots on Jupiter
Regions of the pancreas containing cells that produce hormones

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Regions of the pancreas containing cells that produce hormones

questions.question: If a mathematician has an Erdős number of 2, what does it mean?

options.text: The mathematician was a student of a student of Paul Erdős.
The mathematician was a student of Paul Erdős.
The mathematician has written a paper with someone who has written an academic paper with Paul Erdős.
The mathematician has written an academic paper with Paul Erdős.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The mathematician has written a paper with someone who has written an academic paper with Paul Erdős.

questions.question: Which is the odd one out of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: (General Ambrose) Burnside

questions.question: Which of these queens is not correctly matched with the dynasty to which she belonged?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victoria - Windsor

questions.question: The word nasty originally referred to Thomas Nast who was a 19th century caricaturist with a particularly merciless, biting wit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Name Henry Is daughter who was the first female ruler of the Kingdom of England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matilda

questions.question: The work of Thomas Bowdler gave rise to the verb to bowdlerize. What is bowdlerization?

options.text: Editing a book, film or play to make it suitable for children or people who are easily offended
Making an instrument sterile, by boiling or heating, so that it can be used in a medical procedure
The neutering of stray cats and dogs to keep their numbers down
Treating yarn or thread so that when it is dyed the colour will be fixed and not wash out or fade

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Editing a book, film or play to make it suitable for children or people who are easily offended

questions.question: I think this is the most extraordinary collection of talent, of human knowledge, that has ever been gathered together at the White House, with the possible exception of when Thomas Jefferson dined alone. Which president said it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John F. Kennedy

questions.question: What do Mary I and Elizabeth I have in common?

options.text: They were both daughters of Henry VIII.
They were both born princesses but were later declared illegitimate.
They both produced no heirs to the throne.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: President and Meaning
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who does this quote belong to: It was absolutely involuntary. They sank my boat.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John F. Kennedy

questions.question: Which president made this declaration: A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: What is the meaning of the biblical names Luke and Lucas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luminous

questions.question: Which president made this remark: I heard theres rumors on the Internets that were going to have a draft.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George W. Bush

questions.question: Not wanting to boast, this president said: If I had to name my greatest strength, I guess it would be my humility. Greatest weakness, its possible that Im a little too awesome.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barack Obama

questions.question: What is the meaning of the biblical name Paul?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Small

questions.question: Who made the statement, There is no Soviet domination of Eastern Europe.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerald Ford

questions.question: Who said, If I were a single man, I might ask that mummy out. Thats a good-looking mummy.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Clinton

questions.question: What is the literal meaning of the biblical name Jeremiah?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jehovah exalts

questions.question: What does the biblical name Thomas mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Twin

questions.question: What is the literal translation of the Hebrew name Isaiah?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yahweh is salvation.

questions.question: What president said, There is absolutely no circumstance whatever under which I would accept that spot. Even if they tied and gagged me, I would find a way to signal by wiggling my ears.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: He was elected president after this remark: Ive now been in 57 states -- I think one left to go.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barack Obama

questions.question: When I take action, Im not going to fire a $2 million missile at a $10 empty tent and hit a camel in the butt. Its going to be decisive. Who said it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George W. Bush

questions.question: What does the biblical name Ruth mean in Hebrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Companion

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Lady and Husband
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, middleton. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This politician and humanitarian is the first woman to have been first lady of two different countries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Graça Machel

questions.question: Kate Middletons iconic black see-thru dress that caught Prince Williams attention at a charity fashion show has been sold for a staggering 65,000 pounds. Who designed the once-30 pounds dress while studying fashion design?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlotte Todd

questions.question: What is the meaning of the biblical name Matthew in Hebrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gift of God

questions.question: In 1974, this first lady of Argentina succeeded her husband as president of the country thus becoming the first non-royal female head of state in the Western Hemisphere.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isabel Martínez de Perón

questions.question: This Italian lady was quoted as saying that Barack Obama is handsome three months after her husband, the outspoken Italian premier, sparked controversy by describing the US president as tanned.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Veronica Lario

questions.question: Which US first lady is NOT correctly matched with her nickname?

options.text: Julia Tyler - Shadow of the White House

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julia Tyler - Shadow of the White House

questions.question: The first lady of this European country died in a plane crash on 10 April 2010.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: This US first lady met her husband in the 1930s at a Little Theater group when they were cast together in a mystery drama.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Nixon

questions.question: Prince William first met Cathrine Middleton in 2001 when they were both studying at this university.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of St Andrews

questions.question: She was first lady of Russia from 2000 until 2008 when her husbands tenure as President ended and he was appointed prime minister of Russia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lyudmila Putina

questions.question: Which Speaker of the United States House of Representatives, originally elevated to the Speakership on January 6, 1999, surpassed Joseph Gurney Cannon as the longest-serving Republican Speaker in history on June 1, 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Hastert

questions.question: Before marrying Carla Bruni in 2008, French President Nicolas Sarkozy was married to this former fashion model that he called his strength and [his] Achilles heel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cécilia Ciganer-Albéniz

questions.question: Suzanne Mubarak was First Lady of this African country from 1981 until 2011.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egypt

questions.question: This British barrister expected her husband to take paternity leave when their fourth child was born in 2000.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherie Blair

questions.question: What does the name of Eve, the first woman, mean in Hebrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Living

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Prince William and Kate Middleton
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these notable people declined the invitation to the royal wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton?

options.text: The Crown Prince Naruhito and Crown Princess Masako of Japan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Name Prince William and Kate Middletons honeymoon location where they spent 10 days in a secluded villa.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Seychelles

questions.question: This Irish writer and poet, who became one of the most well-known personalities of his day, was a spokesman for aestheticism. He was known for his biting wit and flamboyant dress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Wilde

questions.question: Name the Irish writer who created the classic Gothic novel Dracula.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bram Stoker

questions.question: Who conducted the royal wedding ceremony on 29 April 2011?

options.text: The Supreme Governor of the Church of England

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Archbishop of Canterbury

questions.question: What Nobel Prize-winning Irish poet and dramatist contributed greatly to the Theatre of the Absurd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel Beckett

questions.question: What Irish actor rose to stardom with his part in Joel Schumachers movie Tigerland, which is set during the Vietnam War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colin Farrell

questions.question: This Irishman, known as the frontman of a famous band, has participated in numerous global charity projects.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bono

questions.question: This English singer-songwriter, who was the only live performer at the wedding reception of Prince William and Kate Middleton, sang her rendition of Elton Johns Your Song for the couples first dance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellie Goulding

questions.question: This Irish-born stage and film actor and director is famous for his film adaptations of Shakespearean plays.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kenneth Branagh

questions.question: Who lent Kate Middleton the Cartier halo-style tiara for the customary bridal theme of something borrowed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Elizabeth II

questions.question: What is the large central gemstone in Lady Dianas famous diamond engagement ring, which Prince William gave to Cathrine Middleton?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: blue sapphire

questions.question: Who is the owner of the blue Aston Martin DB6 in which Prince William and his bride Kate Middleton departed their wedding reception?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince Charles

questions.question: Which Irish-born actress portrayed Jane in the Tarzan film series opposite Johnny Weismuller?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maureen OSullivan

questions.question: Queen Elizabeth II attended Prince William and Cathrine Middletons wedding wearing a dress and accompanying overcoat designed by Angela Kelly. What color were they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: yellow
